definition: to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
to put an end to/to annihilate/to cause to perish/to perish/annihilation (in quantum field theory)
to be shattered/to be annihilated (of hope, illusions etc)
to extinguish/to become extinct/to die out
to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate

sentences.english: Nirodha extinguishes all forms of clinging and attachment.
sentences.chinese: 滅消滅一切形式的執着和依戀。

sentences.english: He who looks outside dreams, he who looks inside awakens.
sentences.chinese: 向外瞅的人在夢中，向內看的人甦醒滅。

sentences.english: Is there anyone who should not have the inactivated pandemic vaccine?
sentences.chinese: 是否有任何人不應當接種大流行性流感滅活疫苗？

sentences.english: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.
sentences.chinese: 和說懷了男胎的那夜都滅沒。

sentences.english: While they preached if any one tried to harm them they got burnt.
sentences.chinese: 當他們傳道時若有人要傷害他們就被火燒滅。

sentences.english: He put out the light and burrowed inside the quilt, hoping to fall asleep. Still it was no good.
sentences.chinese: 滅了燈，把頭完全蓋在被子裏，他想就這麼睡去。

sentences.english: It meeting elephant already past the things of the past similar smoke vapor trail put out.
sentences.chinese: 它就會象已經過去往事一樣煙飛雲滅。
保險絲燒斷了，所有的燈都滅了。

sentences.english: Open thy doors, O Lebanon, that the fire may devour thy cedars.
sentences.chinese: 黎巴嫩哪，開開你的門，任火燒滅你的香柏樹。

sentences.english: The hotel was impressed by the promised results.
sentences.chinese: 公司承諾的滅蟑效果打動了東方賓館。

sentences.english: Winemakers come and go, and we have to update our database.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄酒廠生生滅滅，因此我們必須更新我們的數據庫。

sentences.english: You can't have them that a final Yin trace out glow gradually.
sentences.chinese: 天邊那最後一道霞光漸漸堙滅了蹤跡。

sentences.english: The ganstershave been eliminated and can no longer harm the people.
sentences.chinese: 這股頑匪已被劫滅淨盡，再不能禍害百姓了。

sentences.english: Do it! Ruin him. Just as he did the Cobras .
sentences.chinese: 滅了他，就像他對眼鏡蛇做的一樣。

sentences.english: I shaded it with my cloak to save it from the wind， that is why the lamp went out.
sentences.chinese: 我用斗篷遮住它怕它被風吹滅，因此燈熄了。

definition: to put an end to/to annihilate/to cause to perish/to perish/annihilation (in quantum field theory)

enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to depend on/to hang on in a place/bad/to renege (on promise)/to disclaim/to rat (on debts)/rascally/to blame/to put the blame on
